public abstract int EnableLoopbackRecording(bool enabled, string deviceName);

section.p: If you enable loopback audio capturing, the output of the sound card is mixed into the audio stream sent to the other end.

ul.li: This method applies to macOS and Windows only.

li.ph: macOS does not support loopback capturing of the default sound card. To use this method, use a virtual sound card and pass its name to the SDK as the value of thedeviceName parameter. Based on tests, Agora recommends using soundflower as the virtual sound card.

ul.li: You can call this method either before or after joining a channel.

plentry.pd:
Sets whether to enable loopback capturing.
: Enable loopback audio capturing.
: (Default) Disable loopback capturing.

The device name of the sound card. The default value is (the default sound card). If you use a virtual sound card like "Soundflower", set this parameter as the name of the sound card, "Soundflower". The SDK will find the corresponding sound card and start capturing.
